column1: S100D.CARD.  1. CARD ONE
S100D.DECK.  100. SURVEY NUMBER
S100D.BALLOT.  X. BALLOT NUMBER GENERATED BY ROPER CENTER.

S100D.Q1. WHAT IS YOUR RANK OR GRADE?  1. PRIVATE 2. PRIVATE FIRST CLASS 3. CORPORAL OR TECHNICIAN 5TH GRADE 4. SERGEANT OR TECHNICIAN 4TH GRADE 5. STAFF SERGEANT OR TECHNICIAN 3RD GRADE 6. TECHNICAL SERGEANT, MASTER SERGEANT, OR FIRST SERGEANT 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q2. WHAT BRANCH OF THE ARMY ARE YOU IN NOW?  01. ENGINEERS 02. FIELD ARTILLERY 03. QUARTERMASTER CORPS 04. INFANTRY 05. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 06. ARMORED FORCE 07. SIGNAL CORPS 08. COAST ARTILLERY AND ANTI-AIRCRAFT 09. AIR CORPS 10. TRANSPORTATION CORPS 11. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 12. CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 13. MILITARY POLICE 14. OTHER 00. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q3. IF YOU HAD A CHOICE, WHICH ONE OF THESE BRANCHES OF THE ARMY WOULD YOU LIKE TO BE IN?  01. ENGINEERS 02. FIELD ARTILLERY 03. QUARTERMASTER CORPS 04. INFANTRY 05. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 06. ARMORED FORCE 07. SIGNAL CORPS 08. COAST ARTILLERY AND ANTI-AIRCRAFT 09. AIR CORPS 10. TRANSPORTATION CORPS 11. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 12. CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 13. MILITARY POLICE 14. ALL OTHERS 00. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q4. WHAT MONTH AND YEAR DID YOU JOIN THIS OUTFIT? E. MONTH:  01. JANUARY 02. FEBRUARY 03. MARCH 04. APRIL 05. MAY 06. JUNE 07. JULY 08. AUGUST 09. SEPTEMBER 10. OCTOBER 11. NOVEMBER 12. DECEMBER 00. NO ANSWER E. YEAR:
S100D.Q4. WHAT MONTH AND YEAR DID YOU JOIN THIS OUTFIT? E. MONTH:  46 1. 1940 OR EARLIER 510 2. 1941 184 3. 1942 543 4. 1943 6 5. 1944 8 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 5A NOT CODED.

S100D.Q5B. ABOUT HOW MANY DAYS ALTOGETHER, HAVE YOU BEEN IN COMBAT NOT COUNTING THE DAYS YOU'VE SPENT BACK OF THE LINE OR AWAY FROM THE FRONT?  ANP (ACTUAL NUMBER DAYS) 001. 1 DAY . . . 080. 80 DAYS 000. NONE 999.NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 5C AND 5D NOT CODED.
S100D.Q6. HOW MUCH OF THE TIME YOU WERE IN COMBAT WERE YOU A MEMBER OF THE COMPANY YOU ARE NOW IN?  1. ALL OR MOST OF THE TIME 2. SOME OF THE TIME 3. LITTLE OR NONE OF THE TIME 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q7. ABOUT HOW MANY BATTLE CASUALTIES (KILLED AND WOUNDED) HAS YOUR PRESENT COMPANY HAD SINCE YOU FIRST WENT INTO COMBAT WITH IT?  1. MORE THAN HALF OF THE MEN HAVE BEEN CASUALTIES 2. BETWEEN A QUARTER AND A HALF HAVE BEEN CASUALTIES 3. LESS THAN A QUARTER HAVE BEEN CASUALTIES 4. DON'T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q8A. HOW MANY OF YOUR PRESENT COMPANY OFFICERS ARE THE SAME OFFICERS YOU HAD WHEN YOU FIRST GOT INTO THE FIGHTING?  1. ONE 2. TWO 3. THREE 4. FOUR 5. FIVE 6. SIX 7. NONE 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q8B. NOW THINK OF THESE COMPANY OFFICERS YOU HAD WITH YOU WHEN YOU FIRST GOT INTO THE FIGHTING AND WHO ARE STILL IN YOUR OUTFIT: ON THE WHOLE DO YOU HAVE MORE CONFIDENCE OR LESS CONFIDENCE IN THEM AS LEADERS IN BATTLE NOW THAN YOU HAD AT THE BEGINNING OF COMBAT?  1. I HAVE MORE CONFIDENCE 2. I HAVE LESS CONFIDENCE 3. I HAVE ABOUT THE SAME AMOUNT OF CONFIDENCE 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q8C. AGAIN THINK OF THESE COMPANY OFFICERS YOU HAD WITH YOU WHEN YOU FIRST GOT INTO THE FIGHTING AND WHO ARE STILL IN YOUR OUTFIT: HOW MANY OF THEM DO YOU HAVE CONFIDENCE IN AS LEADERS IN BATTLE?  1. ONE 2. TWO 3. THREE 4. FOUR 5. FIVE 6. SIX 7. NONE 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q9. DO YOU FEEL PROUD OF YOUR COMPANY?  1. YES, VERY PROUD 2. YES, FAIRLY PROUD 3. NO, NOT PROUD 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q10. IN GENERAL, HOW WOULD YOU SAY YOU FEEL MOST OF THE TIME, IN GOOD SPIRITS OR IN LOW SPIRITS?  1. I AM USUALLY IN GOOD SPIRITS 2. I AM IN GOOD SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME AND IN LOW SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME 3. I AM USUALLY IN LOW SPIRITS 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q11. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF THE RIFLEMAN'S JOB IN MODERN BATTLE?  1. MORE IMPORTANT THAN MOST ANY OTHER SOLDIER'S JOB 2. IMPORTANT, BUT NO MORE SO THAN MANY OTHERS 3. NOT VERY IMPORTANT COMPARED WITH WHAT OTHER SOLDIERS CAN DO 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q12A. WHAT SORT OF TEAMWORK DID THE MEN IN YOUR COMPANY SHOW IN ACTUAL BATTLE?  1. VERY GOOD 2. FAIRLY GOOD 3. NOT VERY GOOD 4. NOT GOOD AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q12B. HOW IMPORTANT A PART DO YOU THINK YOUR COMPANY WILL PLAY IN WINNING THE WAR?  1. A VERY IMPORTANT PART 2. A FAIRLY IMPORTANT PART 3. NOT A VERY IMPORTANT PART 4. NOT IMPORTANT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q13. DO YOU USUALLY FEEL THAT WHAT YOU ARE DOING IN THE ARMY IS WORTHWHILE OR NOT?  1. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS WORTHWHILE 2. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS NOT WORTHWHILE 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q14. WHEN YOU WERE FIGHTING IN A PARTICULAR BATTLE, DID YOU EVER HAVE THE FEELING THAT IT WASN'T WORTH THE COST?  1. YES, ALMOST ALWAYS 2. YES, SOMETIMES 3. NO, NEVER 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 15A AND 15B TO BE CODED TOGETHER.

S100D.Q15A. DID YOU EVER HAVE ANY CONTACT WITH JAPANESE PRISONERS?  Q.15B. HOW DID SEEING JAPANESE PRISONERS MAKE YOU FEEL ABOUT THE JAPANESE?  1. YES, I FELT ALL THE MORE LIKE KILLING THEM 2. YES, I FELT THAT THEY ARE MEN JUST LIKE US AND IT IS TOO BAD THAT WE HAVE TO BE FIGHTING THEM 3. YES'I DIDN'T HAVE ANY FEELING ONE WAY OR ANOTHER 4. YES, SOME OTHER FEELING 5. YES, NO ANSWER 6. NO 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q16. WHILE YOU WERE AT THE BATTLE FRONT, DID YOUR LEADERS EXPLAIN THE WHOLE BATTLE SO YOU COULD SEE JUST HOW YOUR COMPANY'S PART FITTED INTO THE CAMPAIGN AS A WHOLE?  1. AS MUCH AS THEY COULD 2. THEY COULD HAVE GIVEN US A LITTLE MORE 3. THEY COULD HAVE GIVEN US A GREAT DEAL MORE 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q17. WHILE YOU WERE IN COMBAT, DID YOU FEEL THAT THE TROOPS TO THE REAR, IN GENERAL, WERE DOING AS MUCH AS THEY COULD UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES, FOR THE MEN WHO WERE DOING THE FIGHTING?  1. AS MUCH AS THEY COULD 2. COULD HAVE DONE SOMEWHAT MORE 3. COULD HAVE DONE A GREAT DEAL MORE 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q18A. HOW ABOUT ATROCITIES? DID YOU PERSONALLY EVER SEE WITH YOUR OWN EYES A CASE OF JAPANESE USING METHODS OF FIGHTING OR TREATING PRISONERS WHICH YOU WOULD CALL DIRTY OR INHUMAN?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q18B. HOW ABOUT STORIES YOU HAVE HEARD FROM OTHERS? DID YOU HEAR ANY TRUE CASES OF JAPANESE USING METHODS OF FIGHTING OR TREATING PRISONERS WHICH YOU WOULD CALL DIRTY OR INHUMAN?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q19. DID YOU RECEIVE ANY OF THE FOLLOWING DECORATIONS?  1. PURPLE HEART 2. SILVER STAR 3. DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS 4. PURPLE HEART AND SILVER STAR 5. PURPLE HEART AND DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS 6. SILVER STAR AND DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS 7. PURPLE HEART, SILVER STAR AND DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS 8. NONE OF THE THREE (PURPLE HEART, SILVER STAR, DISTINGUISHED SERVICE CROSS) 9. OTHER 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q20A. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE SILVER STAR?  1. ALL MEN I KNOW WHO GOT THEM REALLY DESERVED THEM 2. A FEW MEN I KNOW WHO GOT THEM DID NOT DESERVE THEM 3. MANY MEN I KNOW WHO GOT THEM DID NOT DESERVE THEM 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q20B. DO YOU KNOW ANY MEN WHO DESERVED SILVER STARS BUT DID NOT GET THEM?  1. MANY MEN I KNOW DESERVED SILVER STARS BUT DID NOT GET THEM 2. A FEW MEN I KNOW DESERVED SILVER STARS BUT DID NOT GET THEM 3. NOBODY I KNOW DESERVED A SILVER STAR BUT DID NOT GET IT 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q21. IN GENERAL WOULD YOU SAY THAT BATTLE FIGHTING BECAME MORE FRIGHTENING OR LESS FRIGHTENING THE MORE YOU SAW OF IT?  1. IT WAS MORE FRIGHTENING THE MORE I SAW OF IT 2. IT WAS LESS FRIGHTENING THE MORE I SAW OF IT 3. IT WAS NEVER FRIGHTENING 4. IT STAYED FRIGHTENING ALL THE TIME 0. NO ANSWER X. CODES 01-04 PRECODED ON QUESTIONNAIRE, OTHER RESPONSES VOLUNTEERED.

S100D.Q22. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING STATEMENTS BEST TELLS THE WAY YOU WOULD FEEL ABOUT GOING BACK INTO ACTUAL BATTLE?  01. I WANT VERY MUCH TO GET INTO IT AS SOON AS POSSIBLE 02. I AM READY TO GO ANYTIME 03. I HOPE I WON'T HAVE TO GO BUT IF I GO I THINK I WILL DO ALL RIGHT 04. I HOPE I WON'T HAVE TO GO BECAUSE I DON'T THINK I WOULD DO VERY WELL 05. HAVE DONE MY SHARE, LET OTHERS FIGHT 06. NEED A REST OR FURLOUGH FIRST 07. COULDN'T STAND IT, AFRAID, NERVES SHOT 08. PHYSICAL CONDITION 09. QUALIFIED ACCEPTANCE 10. REFUSAL (MISCELLANEOUS) 11. ALL OTHERS 00. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q23. ARE YOU EVER WORRIED AND UPSET?  1. I AM HARDLY EVER WORRIED AND UPSET 2. I AM SOMETIMES WORRIED AND UPSET 3. I AM OFTEN WORRIED AND UPSET 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q24. IN GENERAL, WHAT SORT OF A TIME DO YOU HAVE IN THE ARMY?  1. I HAVE A PRETTY GOOD TIME 2. IT'S ABOUT FIFTY-FIFTY 3. I HAVE A PRETTY ROTTEN TIME 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q25A. DO YOU THINK THAT THE EQUIPMENT OF THE AMERICAN ARMY IS BETTER OR WORSE THAN THE EQUIPMENT OF THE JAPANESE ARMY?  1. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 2. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 3. OUR EQUIPMENT IS ABOUT THE SAME AS THAT OF THE JAPANESE ARMY 4. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 5. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 6. DON'T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q25B. IF YOU THINK SOME JAPANESE WEAPONS ARE BETTER THAN OURS WHAT ARE THEY?  1. NO JAPANESE WEAPONS ARE BETTER THAN OURS 2. SOME JAPANESE WEAPONS ARE BETTER THAN OURS 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q26. THINK OF ALL THE MEN IN YOUR PLATOON (OR EQUIVALENT UNIT) JUST BEFORE YOU WENT INTO ACTION FOR THE FIRST TIME. NOW THINK OF THE ONE MAN WHO HAD SERVED TIME THE MOST IN THE GUARDHOUSE. HOW DID HE DO IN ACTUAL BATTLE AS COMPARED WITH OTHER MEN IN THE PLATOON?  1. HE DID MUCH BETTER THAN AVERAGE 2. HE DID BETTER THAN AVERAGE 3. SAME AS AVERAGE 4. HE DID WORSE THAN AVERAGE 5. HE DID MUCH WORSE THAN AVERAGE 6. ANY OTHER ANSWER 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q27. HOW MANY OF THE NON-COMS IN YOUR OUTFIT ARE THE KIND YOU WOULD WANT TO SERVE UNDER IN COMBAT?  1. ALL OF THEM ARE 2. MOST OF THEM ARE 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM ARE 4. FEW OF THEM ARE 5. NONE OF THEM ARE 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q28A. HOW MANY OF THE OFFICERS IN YOUR COMPANY ARE THE KIND YOU WOULD WANT TO SERVE UNDER IN COMBAT?  1. ALL OF THEM ARE 2. MOST OF THEM ARE 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM ARE 4. FEW OF THEM ARE 5. NONE OF THEM ARE 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q28B. HOW MANY OF YOUR COMPANY OFFICERS ARE THE KIND WHO ARE WILLING TO GO THROUGH ANYTHING THEY ASK THEIR MEN TO GO THROUGH?  1. ALL OF THEM ARE 2. MOST OF THEM ARE 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM ARE 4. FEW OF THEM ARE 5. NONE OF THEM ARE 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q28C. HOW MANY OF YOUR OFFICERS TAKE A PERSONAL INTEREST IN THEIR MEN?  1. ALL OF THEM DO 2. MOST OF THEM DO 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM DO 4. FEW OF THEM DO 5. NONE OF THEM DO 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q29. DO YOU EVER GET THE FEELING THAT THIS WAR IS NOT WORTH FIGHTING?  1. VERY OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONLY ONCE IN A GREAT WHILE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q30. DO YOU THINK THERE WILL BE ANOTHER WAR IN THE NEXT 25 YEARS OR SO?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q31. AFTER THE WAR IS OVER, DO YOU THINK THE UNITED STATES WILL BE A BETTER PLACE OR A WORSE PLACE TO LIVE IN THAN IT WAS BEFORE THE WAR?  1. WORSE AFTER THE WAR THAN BEFORE THE WAR 2. SAME AFTER THE WAR AS BEFORE THE WAR 3. BETTER AFTER THE WAR THAN BEFORE THE WAR 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q32A. WHICH COMES CLOSEST TO YOUR IDEA OF HOW HARD IT IS GOING TO BE TO BEAT THE GERMANS?  1. IT WILL NOT BE VERY HARD 2. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, BUT OUR LOSSES WON'T BE HEAVY 3. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, WITH HEAVY LOSSES OF MEN AND EQUIPMENT 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q32B. WHICH COMES CLOSEST TO YOUR IDEA OF HOW HARD IT IS GOING TO BE TO BEAT THE JAPANESE?  1. IT WILL NOT BE VERY HARD 2. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, BUT OUR LOSSES WON'T BE HEAVY 3. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, WITH HEAVY LOSSES OF MEN AND EQUIPMENT 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q33. DO YOU THINK A SOLDIER WITH ABILITY HAS A GOOD CHANCE FOR PROMOTION IN THE ARMY?  1. A VERY GOOD CHANCE 2. A FAIRLY GOOD CHANCE 3. NOT MUCH OF A CHANCE 4. NO CHANCE AT ALL 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q34. DURING COMBAT, HOW DID YOU FEEL ABOUT NEW REPLACEMENTS WHO CAME IN AS NON-COMS?  1. I THOUGHT IT WAS O.K. 2. I THOUGHT IT WAS BAD 3. I DID NOT CARE MUCH ONE WAY OR ANOTHER 4. THIS DID NOT HAPPEN IN MY COMPANY 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q35A. TACTICAL AIR FORCE?  1. GOOD 2. POOR 3. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q35B. MEDICAL TROOPS?  1. GOOD 2. POOR 3. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q35C. QUARTERMASTER TROOPS?  1. GOOD 2. POOR 3. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q35D. ORDNANCE TROOPS?  1. GOOD 2. POOR 3. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q35E. ENGINEER TROOPS?  1. GOOD 2. POOR 3. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q35F. ARTILLERY?  1. GOOD 2. POOR 3. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q35G. TANKS?  1. GOOD 2. POOR 3. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 35H NOT CODED.
S100D.Q35I. MARINES?  1. GOOD 2. POOR 3. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q35J. INFANTRY?  1. GOOD 2. POOR 3. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q36. DID SUPPLIES YOU MUCH WANTED OR NEEDED AT THE FRONT EVER FAIL TO REACH YOU?  1. WE USUALLY GOT WHAT WE NEEDED 2. WE OFTEN DID NOT GET WHAT WE NEEDED 3. WE SELDOM GOT WHAT WE NEEDED 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q37. HAVE YOU LISTENED TO RADIO TOKYO? IF YES, HOW DID YOU FEEL ABOUT THE RADIO PROPAGANDA?  1. YES, MOSTLY LIES 2. YES, MOSTLY LIES, BUT MAYBE A LITTLE MORE TRUTH THAN WE CARE TO ADMIT 3. YES, A LOT OF TRUTH IN WHAT THEY SAID 4. YES, NO ANSWER 5. NO 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q38A. WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE HAPPEN TO THE JAPANESE AFTER THE WAR?  1. PUNISH THE LEADERS, BUT NOT THE ORDINARY JAPANESE 2. MAKE THE ORDINARY JAPANESE PEOPLE SUFFER PLENTY 3. WIPE OUT THE WHOLE JAPANESE NATION 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q38B. WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE HAPPEN TO THE GERMANS AFTER THE WAR?  1. PUNISH THE LEADERS, BUT NOT THE ORDINARY GERMAN 2. MAKE THE ORDINARY GERMAN PEOPLE SUFFER PLENTY 3. WIPE OUT THE WHOLE GERMAN NATION 0. NO ANSWER P. THE OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL IS INTERESTED IN FINDING OUT FROM MEN LIKE YOURSELF WITH PROVED COMBAT EXPERIENCE, INFORMATION WHICH WILL AID IN SELECTION OF MEN FOR TYPES OF COMBAT DUTY. WHATEVER YOU MAY THINK OF QUESTIONS 39-48 PLEASE ANSWER THEM SERIOUSLY AND CONSCIENTIOUSLY, AS THE INFORMATION WHEN THEY ARE ALL TABULATED SCIENTIFICALLY WILL BE VALUABLE.
S100D.Q39A. ARE YOU EVER BOTHERED BY NERVOUSNESS?  1. YES, OFTEN 2. YES, SOMETIMES 3. NO, NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q39B. DO YOU OFTEN HAVE TROUBLE IN GETTING TO SLEEP?  1. VERY OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ALMOST NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q39C. ARE YOU EVER TROUBLED BY YOUR HANDS SWEATING SO THAT THEY FEEL DAMP AND CLAMMY?  1. YES, OFTEN 2. YES, SOMETIMES 3. NO, NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q39D. HOW OFTEN ARE YOU BOTHERED BY HAVING AN UPSET STOMACH?  1. NEARLY ALL THE TIME 2. PRETTY OFTEN 3. NOT VERY OFTEN 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q39E. DO YOUR HANDS EVER TREMBLE ENOUGH TO BOTHER YOU?  1. YES, OFTEN 2. YES, SOMETIMES 3. NO, NEVER 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q39F. BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARMY DID YOU USUALLY GO AROUND WITH A BUNCH OF OTHERS OR BY YOURSELF?  1. I USUALLY WENT AROUND BY MYSELF 2. I USUALLY WENT AROUND WITH JUST ONE OR TWO OTHERS 3. I USUALLY WENT AROUND WITH A BUNCH OF OTHERS 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q39G. ON THE WHOLE, BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARMY DID YOU USUALLY LIKE TO BE BY YOURSELF OR TO BE WITH OTHER PEOPLE?  1. USUALLY LIKED BETTER TO BE BY MYSELF 2. USUALLY LIKED BETTER TO BE WITH OTHER PEOPLE 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q39H. BEFORE GOING INTO COMBAT WERE YOU EVER A.W.O.L.*  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER CARD 2
S100D.CARD.  2. CARD TWO
S100D.DECK.  100. SURVEY NUMBER
S100D.BALLOT.  X. BALLOT NUMBER GENERATED BY ROPER CENTER.

S100D.FORM.  1. S-100A 2. S-100B 3. S-100C 4. S-10XX 5. S-100E 6. S-100F 7. S-100G Q.40XXXXXXW IS A LIST OF THINGS COMMONLY FEARED BY CHILDREN. SOME OF THEM ARE IMPORTANT IN MEDICAL HISTORIES, BUT NOTHING IS KNOWN ABOUT HOW THE AVERAGE COMBAT SOLDIER HAS BEEN AFRAID OF THESE THINGS. CHECK ONE ANSWER AFTER EACH THING LISTED TO SHOW HOW MUCH YOU YOURSELF WERE AFRAID OF IT WHEN YOU WERE A KID.
S100D.Q40A. BEING ON HIGH PLACES?  1. VERY MUCH 2. A LITTLE 3. NOT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q40B. BEING SHUT UP IN A ROOM OR CLOSET?  1. VERY MUCH 2. A LITTLE 3. NOT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q40C. FALLING?  1. VERY MUCH 2. A LITTLE 3. NOT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q40D. SNAKES?  1. VERY MUCH 2. A LITTLE 3. NOT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q40E. BEING CALLED ON TO RECITE IN CLASS?  1. VERY MUCH 2. A LITTLE 3. NOT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q41. HOW DID YOU FEEL ABOUT FIGHTING AS A KID?  1. REALLY LIKED FIGHTING 2. DIDN'T PARTICULARLY LIKE IT OR DISLIKE IT 3. DIDN'T LIKE FIGHTING AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q42. IN GENERAL, DID YOU USUALLY FEEL MORE SCARED BEFORE GOING INTO COMBAT, DURING COMBAT, OR AFTER COMBAT?  1. BEFORE GOING INTO COMBAT 2. DURING COMBAT 3. AFTER COMBAT 4. TWO CHECKED 5. ALL THREE CHECKED 6. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43A. VIOLENT POUNDING OF THE HEART?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43B. SINKING FEELING IN THE STOMACH?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43C. FEELING OF WEAKNESS OR FEELING FAINT?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43D. FEELING SICK AT THE STOMACH?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43E. COLD SWEAT?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43F. VOMITING?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43G. SHAKING OR TREMBLING ALL OVER?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43H. URINATING IN PANTS?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43I. LOSING CONTROL OF BOWELS?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q43J. FEELING OF STIFFNESS?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q44A. HAVE YOU BEEN SENT TO A HOSPITAL OR A REST CAMP BECAUSE OF MALARIA SINCE YOU LEFT THE UNITED STATES?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q44B. HAVE YOU BEEN SENT TO A HOSPITAL OR REST CAMP BECAUSE OF ANY SICKNESS SINCE YOU LEFT THE UNITED STATES?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q45. IN YOUR OPINION WHAT SHOULD BE DONE WITH MEN WHO CRACK UP IN ACTION, THAT IS, MEN WHO GET SHELL-SHOCKED, BLOW THEIR TOPS, GO HAYWIRE?  1. MOST OF THEM SHOULD BE TREATED AS SICK MEN 2. MOST OF THEM SHOULD BE TREATED AS COWARDS AND PUNISHED 3. MOST OF THEM SHOULD BE TREATED SOME OTHER WAY 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q46. DID YOU SEE ANY OF YOUR BEST FRIENDS GET KILLED IN COMBAT?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 47A AND 47B NOT CODED.
S100D.Q48A. DO YOU THINK YOU WERE IN TOUGH ENOUGH PHYSICAL CONDITION AT THE TIME YOU WENT INTO YOUR FIRST BATTLE?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q48B. IN GENERAL, WHAT SORT OF PHYSICAL CONDITION WOULD YOU SAY YOU ARE IN AT THE PRESENT TIME?  1. VERY GOOD PHYSICAL CONDITION 2. GOOD PHYSICAL CONDITION 3. FAIR PHYSICAL CONDITION 4. POOR PHYSICAL CONDITION 5. VERY POOR PHYSICAL CONDITION 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q49A. DO YOU THINK THE ARMY TRIED HARD ENOUGH TO GET GOOD FOOD TO YOU AT THE BATTLE FRONT?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q49B. DO YOU THINK THE ARMY TRIED HARD ENOUGH TO GET MAIL REGULARLY TO YOU AT THE BATTLE FRONT?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER P. MANY MEN REPORT THAT THINKING ABOUT CERTAIN THINGS HELPS THEM GET THROUGH WHEN THE GOING GETS TOUGH. SOLDIERS WITH DIFFERENT TYPES OF EXPERIENCE HAVE DIFFERENT VIEWS. WHAT WOULD YOU SAY ON THE BASIS OF YOUR EXPERIENCE?

S100D.Q50A. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH DID IT HELP YOU TO THINK THAT YOU HAD TO FINISH THE JOB IN ORDER TO GET HOME AGAIN?  1. IT HELPED A LOT 2. IT HELPED SOME 3. IT HELPED A LITTLE 4. IT DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN'T THINK OF IT 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q50B. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH DID IT HELP YOU TO THINK THAT YOU COULDN'T LET THE OTHER MEN DOWN?  1. IT HELPED A LOT 2. IT HELPED SOME 3. IT HELPED A LITTLE 4. IT DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN'T THINK OF IT 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q50C. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH DID IT HELP YOU TO THINK OF WHAT WE ARE FIGHTING FOR?  1. IT HELPED A LOT 2. IT HELPED SOME 3. IT HELPED A LITTLE 4. IT DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN'T THINK OF IT 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q50D. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH WERE YOU HELPED BY THOUGHTS OF HATRED FOR THE ENEMY?  1. THEY HELPED A LOT 2. THEY HELPED SOME 3. THEY HELPED A LITTLE 4. THEY DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN'T HAVE SUCH THOUGHTS 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q50E. WHEN THE GOING WAS TOUGH, HOW MUCH DID PRAYER HELP YOU?  1. IT HELPED A LOT 2. IT HELPED SOME 3. IT HELPED A LITTLE 4. IT DID NOT HELP AT ALL 5. I DIDN'T THINK OF IT 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 51A, 51B AND 51C NOT CODED.

S100D.Q51D. HOW SATISFIED ARE YOU ABOUT BEING IN YOUR PRESENT ARMY JOB INSTEAD OF SOME OTHER ARMY JOB?  1. VERY SATISFIED 2. SATISFIED 3. VERY DISSATISFIED 4. DISSATISFIED 5. IT DOESN'T MAKE ANY DIFFERENCE TO ME 0. NO ANSWER

S100D.Q52. CHECK THE ANSWER THAT TELLS BEST HOW FAR YOU WENT IN SCHOOL:  1. DID NOT FINISH GRADE SCHOOL 2. FINISHED GRADE SCHOOL 3. HAD SOME HIGH SCHOOL, BUT DID NOT GRADUATE 4. GRADUATED FROM HIGH SCHOOL 5. HAD SOME COLLEGE, BUT DID NOT GRADUATE 6. GRADUATED FROM COLLEGE 0. NO ANSWER
S100D.Q53. ARE YOU:  1. SINGLE 2. MARRIED AND HAVE NO CHILDREN 3. MARRIED AND DO HAVE CHILDREN 4. WIDOWED, DIVORCED, OR SEPARATED 0. NO ANSWER
